snippet: Even as the European Commission puts the final touches on a regulatory plan for banks, some countries are seeking to modify or delay the proposed system.
abstract: Some Central and Eastern European countries, along with Germany, seek to modify or delay a proposed regulatory plan for a central bank supervisor that the European Commission is in the process of finalizing; plan's main elements are expected to include transferring regulatory oversight of all banks in the 17 European Union countries that use the euro to the European Central Bank in Frankfurt.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Even as the European Commission puts the final touches on a regulatory plan for banks, some countries are seeking to modify or delay the proposed system.

headline.seo: As Europe Readies Bank Plan, Last-Minute Jitters and a Move to Pull Back
headline.main: Integrating Banks Spurs Last-Minute Fears in Europe
headline.print_headline: As Europe Readies Bank Plan, Last-Minute Jitters and a Move to Pull Back
